bug.author: gaoning777
bug.summary: permission error during deployment when GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIAL is set as the environment
bug.description: If the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIAL is set as the environment variable, kfctl uses this credential directly instead of the credential from 'gcloud auth application-default login'. The error looks like: Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Apply failed for gcp: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: gcp apply could not update deployment manager Error Set Cleared IamPolicy error: googleapi: Error 403: The caller does not have permission, forbidden Usage: kfctl apply [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Apply failed for gcp: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: gcp apply could not update deployment manager Error Set Cleared IamPolicy error: googleapi: Error 403: The caller does not have permission, forbidden After GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIAL is unset, it works. It is probably a better idea for the kfctl to skip using GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIAL.

couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Apply failed for gcp: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: gcp apply could not update deployment manager Error Set Cleared IamPolicy error: googleapi: Error 403: The caller does not have permission, forbidden
The error is indicating there is a problem setting the IAM Policy. This requires owner permissions or IAM policy admin permissions. This is needed if you want kfctl to do things like create and install service accounts. If you don't have sufficient permission to do that then you will either need to
Get someone with owner permissions to do that for you
Follow the instructions for installing on an existing K8s cluster (https://v0-5.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/)
This will skip GCP specific setup that requires elevated permissions But it means we won't do things like setup service accounts, DNS, or IAP So that would have to be setup separately
